intro: Valeriana collina var. simplex, commonly known as the simple valerian, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, branched stems. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in dense spikes, which bloom in late summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to elliptic, and have a distinctive, slightly hairy texture. Valeriana collina var. simplex is often found in meadows, woodlands, and along streambanks, where it thrives in moist, well-drained soils.
